summary: Foreign animal diseases—which may infect people—pose threats to the U.S. The Department of Homeland Security is building the National Bio and Agro-Defense Facility to address them. It is transferring ownership of this facility to USDA, which will use it for research and vaccine development. The 2 agencies are following practices for a successful transfer—e.g., USDA is collaborating with stakeholders to define the facility's mission. But...
title: National Bio and Agro-defense Facility: DHS and USDA Are Working to Transfer Ownership and Prepare for Operations, but Critical Steps Remain
